pros: there are friendly staff here
cons: there is no cons here

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Palm Harbor, FL
pros: It’s great place to work. They work with your schedule And a understanding of your issues
cons: We work with a lot of Covid positive patients. The downside is is that you care for these residents with Covid and I susceptible to contracting the virus. However, they do not pay you when you do for downtime you must use your vacation pay in order to be paid if you were out due to Covid from working with Covid positive residence. Which is completely unfair, considering you contracted the virus from taking care of the Covid positive patients, but there is no conversation in place once you have contracted the virus and have to be off work yourself

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palm Harbor, FL
pros:
Caring, compassionate, & rewarding place to work! 
Benefits are very good & PTO is very generous.
Lots of opportunity to learn & grow.
cons: I have found them willing to work through any concerns & listen to ideas or suggestions for change.

job_title: Life Enrichment Coordinator in Palm Harbor, FL
pros: Great experience working with the elderly.
cons: Lack of growth potential within the company.

pros: Good staff, Great residents, Free food, Christmas bonus check
cons: Bad pay, Pretty short shifts

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Holiday, FL
pros: Great benefits and good salary
cons: Take you for grunted for work that you go over and beyond your duties

review_title: Not a career opportunity! Just a job.
job_title: Dietary Aide in Palm Harbor, FL
pros: Up to 2 hours break if you're in the right department, but it's all unpaid. Some downtime in some departments but don't always count on it. The benefits are really good and they listen to employee suggestions to improve the workplace sometimes. You can transfer to other departments if they have job openings. Good concern for safety and health because it's a senior community.
cons: Pay is VERY low considering all you gatta put up with. DRAMA. Lots of it! Caused by the high schoolers mostly. If they don't like you they'll try to get you in trouble or fired. The employees here love to talk about others behind their backs, backstab, and cause trouble for others. Training is a joke. If you don't work with the adults you wont get trained. The teens don't "train." They like to pretend you already know what you're doing. They rarely even work. Huge lack of common sense in this place! The residents are rich, old people so a lot of them will treat you like you're slave trash. If a resident complains about something you do, heaven forbid, you might even get fired, so try to do your best by them.

job_title: CNA in Highland Lakes, Highlands, FL
pros: Philosophy of the company is good.  Residents are happy and their needs are met   Most staff go above and beyond to keep them happy.
cons: So here is the hard thing to understand.  They are laying off people, but seems like no management positions are being cut.  There are many managers there and some of those are family members of the CEO .   A not for profit, no one owns the company has pros and cons.  Head Chief needs to look at lead positions to cut back on even if it is a family member .  I think residents would benefit financially from that and also not give appearance of favoritism

review_title: Residents are great.  Most staff are also nice and work as a team.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palm Harbor, FL
pros: Benefits, location, quality care to residents.  No lingering urine smells in the nursing home.
cons: Pay could be more for us support workers.  Building is older so it is a little harder to maintain.  There are a lot of managers for this size of facility so not sure if that is a good thing for their budget.  Reason I left was personal but was influenced by the Covid virus and some upper management don't always practice what they preach.

review_title: One of the best companies I've ever worked.
pros: Very caring and understanding of residents, employees and family members.
cons: Parking lot needs to be enlarged again for the afternoon shift.

pros: Team work experience, fun and helpful people, and great work environment.
cons: Short hours, exhaustion, and low pay.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse Charge Nurse in Palm Harbor, FL
pros: Experience. No other pros except maybe meeting coworkers who experience same treatment.
cons: Revolving door. Fires at leisure based on CEO preference. For profit. Large case load. No internal support. Discrimination.
